author: By Emma Munbodh
title: Easyjet deals: Top tricks to find cheap flights and holidays to Europe
text:
Budget airline easyJet is one of Britain's biggest low-cost airlines, with flights all-year-round to Europe and beyond from £19.99.
Based at London's Luton Airport in Bedforshire, the airline offers scheduled services to 32 countries including Morocco, Spain and Turkey.
For tips on how to bag bargain flights and cheap package holidays with easyJet , see our top hacks below.
For more tricks, see our Tripadvisor hacks guide on how to save on restaurants, hotels and on-the-day flights. Booking a city break? Here are 10 places to visit, and how to do it for less .
How to find cheap 2015 summer holiday deals The easyJet website has a dedicated 2015 summer holiday deals section, regularly populated with their best deals going.
Prices start at £310-ish per person for 7-nights - the time period is July to early October.
Keep an eye on this page, as more offers will be added closer to the time as airlines rush to fill spaces.
For family holiday deals all year round see their family deals section .
How to find cheap city breaks deals Rex Find bargain flights to The Eiffel Tower, Paris, France
It is recommended that you book at least six weeks in advance to take advantage of the best city breaks deals.
Be open-minded and you'll save the most. You can see the best deals going on their great value escapes page.
Click on a destination or star rating to find out what the cheapest deals are against your particular dates.
For package deals from £80 EasyJet has made a name for itself as a cheap go-to for cheap flights, but they also do 3-5* package breaks - and they can be pretty cheap too.
Take a look at their Special deals section for their best offers on package holidays - prices start from around £80 and destinations vary from Berlin to Menorca.
To narrow it down, see their 3-star deals , 4-star deals and 5-star deals sections.
For last minute package holidays all year round Holiday bliss: Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, where the sun hits all year round
Whether you're booking a trip to Germany for the Christmas Markets, or want to make the most of a long weekend, easyJet offers late package deals with prices from £383.57.
For cheap one-way flights The best place to keep an eye on for cheap single or return flights is the easyJet homepage where all of the biggest sales and deals are advertised.
Current deals include Cologne from £23.49 and Basel from £27.49 - both to travel June 2015.
easyJet has a price match guarantee - so use it If you find the same holiday with the same easyJet flights and the same accommodation - easyJet will match it - and give you an extra £10 off.
Claims can only be made providing flights and accommodation match the exact same times, route, number of passengers and the same board basis and room type.
You can read more about the easyJet price match guarantee here .
Top 5 easyJet things to ask... Do you NEED extra luggage? Use hand luggage where possible as easyJet will charge you extra to stow luggage in the hold - £11 in advance, £30 at check-in and £45 at the gate.
Easyjet's hand luggage criteria is slightly smaller than major airlines - 50 x 40 x 20cm including wheels and handles.
Check in online - it'll save you time and possibly money at some airports
Watch out for auto-insurance
Transfers not included? Go via public transport and save pounds
Keep an eye on the sales.... For more holiday news, including flash sales, see our holiday deals page, or our weekly guide on the last minute deals .
